channel.title: AI-Assisted Academic Feed
channel.description: This feed is generated by Acafeed.

item.title: Electrical control of photon spin angular momentum in organic electroluminescent materials
item.description:
Nature Photonics, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41566-025-01780-4

Electrical tuning of the recombination zone in circularly polarized (CP) OLEDs enables switching the CP generation mechanism between normal and anomalous CP electroluminescence. This is exploited to electrically control the handedness of emitted CP light from the same device with the same enantiomer material.

item.title: Improving electron microscopy with light
item.description:
Nature Photonics, Published online: 02 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41566-025-01798-8

Shining intense laser pulses on an electron beam in an electron microscope corrects electron-optical spherical aberration, paving the way to using light to improve electron microscopy imaging.

item.title: Self-assembled cell-scale containers made from DNA origami membranes
item.description:
Nature Materials, Published online: 28 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41563-025-02418-0

Through the programmable self-assembly of lipid-inspired radially symmetric DNA, porous molecular membranes and cell-sized compartments are formed with applications in bottom-up biology and soft robotics.

item.title: Super-expansive thermo-reversible interstitial solid solution of nanocrystal superlattices with mesogens
item.description:
Nature Materials, Published online: 28 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41563-025-02388-3

Combining liquid crystals and nanocrystals functionalized with promesogenic ligands yields an interstitial colloidal solid solution exhibiting high thermal expansivity and reversible superlattice phase transitions driven by mesogen diffusion.

item.title: Ultrafast time-resolved observation of non-thermal current-induced switching in an antiferromagnetic Weyl semimetal
item.description:
Nature Materials, Published online: 04 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41563-025-02402-8

This study reveals spatiotemporally resolved current-induced switching in Mn3Sn thin films, identifying both thermal and non-thermal mechanisms depending on the amplitude of the current.

item.title: Shining a light on interfacial conductivity
item.description:
Nature Materials, Published online: 04 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41563-025-02427-z

Ultraviolet illumination dramatically increases electrical conductivity at the interface between two oxide compounds.

item.title: Breaking the rule of reciprocity in soft composite solids
item.description:
Nature Materials, Published online: 04 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41563-025-02435-z

Borrowing an idea from granular physics, researchers design and engineer soft composite materials with non-reciprocal static and dynamical mechanical behaviours, which could power the next generation of soft robots.

item.title: Cryogenically self-healing organic crystals
item.description:
Nature Materials, Published online: 05 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41563-025-02411-7

Cryogenic conditions limit molecular diffusion, inhibiting self-healing in most molecular systems. Here the authors present an organic molecular crystal capable of autonomous recovery at 77 K due to strong dipole–dipole interactions between aligned molecular layers.

item.title: P-wave magnetism in a metal
item.description:
Nature Materials, Published online: 05 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41563-025-02431-3

P-wave magnetism in a metal
